• I got even more arguments for and why it's BETTER than the mace, but i reached the character limit lol

 

  • the mace was PROUDLY announced as the strongest weapon in the game a year ago, with PRIDE... the mace dealing infinite damage is a part of its core functionality, it's a part of its brand, plus... believe it or not, the mace is SURPRISINGLY balanced in competitive PVP... so the spear shouldn't COMPETE whatsoever... the mace should be the only weapon that deals infinite damage.

 

  • even from a game design perspective... how does a spear deal infinite damage? why wouldn't a shovel deal infinite damage (it's literally the same crafting recipe), why wouldn't a sword deal infinite damage? the spear is quite literally just a longer version of the sword..... it doesn't make sense from a game design perspective whatsoever......

Damage cap? The mace is EASILY better than the spear in damage, you can go infinite blocks up whenever you want, at what place you want. But with the spear, if you want ALOT of speed, you need to build a redstone machine that boosts you and etc.

 

Also, to the 'everybody is happy' message that you said, I'm not sure about that one, more people would be angry than happy. And if it breaks PvP, servers can easily program a plugin with a damage cap, if that is what they want. Or, just dont play it
The spear is really janky when I try to use it
i tested it, wooden spears take 4 hits to kill an elder guardian with elytra + firework rocket boost. that is a kill in less hits than a netherite sword would need.

I think the spear needs to have a durability that breaks the harder you hit something. Considering how cheap it is to make, being pretty much just a shovel, I disagree with the comment about ignoring it. In multiplayer, you don't always get that choice.
Yeah, I tested it on the snapshot and It's overpowered.
I agree, maybe some sort of cap on damage, or if not maybe all durability is removed and it breaks over a certain damage? That would be better since its already a pretty cheap weapon.
They should just nerf the damage it is when combined with an elytra. Same with the mace but only when fall damage is off but that’s a whole new discussion.

For those who enjoy the concept of the Feisty Ghast, there are two other Nether suggestions by the same person that aim to give two other aspects of the dimension just as much love as the Ghast.


Having trouble hunting Ghasts for their tears? - consider mining some quartz to craft Quartz tools to pull them in while blocking off those nasty fireballs.

Need a walking torch that can help you see in the dark and guard your back while mining? - the Cinder might be your second best friend (just be sure to keep them lit).

See the posts "Arrow's texture", "The firefly bush modification", "Jungle biome diversity", "Lilypad, and soul lilypad", "Dry, and fruit bush and a new bush drop", "Maple tree and ambar ore", "New fruit trees", "Tumbleweed", "Dry tall and short grass on savanas", "Abou the new cows", "About the new pigs", "Aether", "Crafiting and chest update" and "The Pale Boss", this posts were all made by me, and is a continuation of this.

I can really relate to this because I have a base really high in the sky so I can't take my dog there easily even with leads. It will be a lot better if you can hold your dog or cat on your hand or lap.

Eternal night is already possible using commands. Do " /time set 18000 " followed by " /gamerule doDaylightCycle false ".  this will set the game to eternal night. If you do not have access to commands, ie. on Bedrock with achievements, then this cannot help you. I hate that commands = no achievement hunting on Bedrock.
if you just do commands its easy

There already is. Do /daylock then change the time to night and there. Permanent night. And before u say "oh well I have to activate cheats" to get Permanent day u need cheats on as well. So it's the same. Solution solved. Sorry, but no vote from me.
Yeah honestly this is alreadY a thing

yes

they should make sponges renewable but very rare, i think they should drop with some chance from a guardian variant that's between basic guardian and elder guardian

This is not necessary because you can use hopper and a storage block under your chest for unsorted items. It will clear the chest so the golem will always put unsorted items there. Just make sure the golem can't open the storage block under the hopper.
Do copper golems always evaluate empty chests last, tho? My understanding was that they check up to ten chests one at a time.
unstackable items

I've tested a few setups, some setups the golems go past every chest in order, sometimes they pick a chest randomly. They don't actually care if an item is already in a chest or not, (so having multiple empty chests can spread out the same item across different chests but that is a seperate issue/limitation). While for specific contraptions using a setup that is guaranteed to work works, making it more reliable allows more creativity in builds while being functional. The current solution is more working around the current limitations than an intended solution.
This function all ready exists.
Why are people saying this already exists? If it already existed, this thread wouldn't be made, right?
Yes. We should be able to see lodestones and (especially) beacons on the locater bar.

I full agree.... the Durability difference between Stone, Copper, and Iron being less than One Stack seems very inefficent, and the fact Diamond has 1561, versus Iron having only 250 in spite of it's increased rarity following Caves and Cliffs, I think made little sense... and should have been increased after the generation was changed.

especially since Copper largely took it's place, but it's weaker durability, along with the fact it can't mine Gold or Redstone while Iron can, also seem to diss the entire purpose of being able to increase Copper usage as a material versus jumping straight from Stone to Iron, because if mining with Copper brings no benefit besides lasting a few extra blocks before replacing... hardly anyone will have an interest in using it.

I just watched IBXToycat's video on it, and while copper tools are excellent, there's a gameplay change that'd be PHENOMENAL to see.

Yes, increasing the durability of iron to 500 would be great, enchanting would be SO much more worth and even that would be enough

But copper tools should be able to mine everything iron tools can, except diamonds (and maybe emeralds).
Having copper stuff be good but still requiring iron for progression, and iron is still worth it to have in progression, would make it so much smoother gameplay wise.
